data.title: Joe MacPherson
data.meta_description: Joe is looking to study & play college golf from Spring/Fall 2024. For more information regarding Joe please do get in touch.
data.text:
Player

Introduction.

I am thrilled to introduce you to student athlete Joe MacPherson. Joe is currently taking a gap year to focus on his golf. Joe is a tremendous athlete, a mature young man with a bright future ahead of him. Joe is a talented golfer and a true competitor, he embraces any challenge he faces and loves competing at the highest level. With numerous top 10 finishes, having gone as low as 7 under and having competed with some of the worlds best at the R&A British Boys in 2023, I am excited to see what Joe can go on to achieve in 2024.

Availability:

Available.

Joe is looking to study & play college golf from Spring/Fall 2024. For more information regarding Joe please do get in touch.

Successful qualification for the R&A Boys Amateur (2023)

Player

Interview.

How would you describe yourself?

I am very ambitious and keen to progress my golf career as far as I possibly can. I have always been hard working and I understand that the best results in both my golf and academic careers will be achieved through dedication to practise and studying. I am also a very sociable person and therefore enjoy the opportunity golf gives to meet new people.

What age did you start playing golf and why?

I began playing aged 8 along with my Dad and enjoyed being with my friends as part of a thriving junior group at my local club.

How would you say you have developed as a golfer over the past few years?

I feel that my game has improved significantly in the last 12 months as I have solely focussed on golf rather than splitting my time across other sports. In the last year I have also benefited from dedicated professional coaching, which I have found has helped to improve my game hugely.

Who is your favourite golfer and why?

Rory Mcilroy. Even though he is obviously naturally very talented, he has also dedicated himself to the fitness and technical elements of the game. This ensures that he is able to reach his full potential and even after achieving so much, he continues to look to improve.

What do you intend to study and why?

I am particularly interested in economics and business as these are the subjects I have enjoyed most during school and feel will be of the most relevance to me as I try to progress my career.

Other than golf what else do you enjoy doing and why?

I am interested in all sports but in particular football and enjoy spending time in the gym working to improve my strength and fitness. I also enjoy listening to music and spending time with my friends.
